revised_title: The Role of Red Corpuscles in Blood Arterialization
tldr: The author, George Owen Rees, discovered that the red corpuscles of the blood play a crucial role in the process of arterialization. He found that when venous blood is exposed to oxygen during respiration, the phosphorus in the corpuscles combines with oxygen to form a tribasic phosphate of soda, which gives blood its bright arterial tint. This process occurs naturally in the body and can also be artificially replicated.
